newsitem.title: NEW ZEALAND: NZ's Mercury Energy lifts year profit 25 percent.
newsitem.headline: NZ's Mercury Energy lifts year profit 25 percent.

text.p: Unlisted Auckland electricity retailer Mercury Energy Ltd said on Friday it lifted net profit in the March year by 25 percent to NZ$82.1 million.
Mercury, which plans to publicly list next year, said its operating profit rose 23.3 percent to $121.7 million.
Operating revenue was up by $82 million to $580.2 million.
Chariman Jim Macaulay said it was a demanding last quarter in view of the company's commitment to keep prices stable until the beginning of 1998.
In the future, the company would be protected by price increases from generators by its own capacity covering 50 percent of requirements coming on steam.
Mercury plans investing $120 million in the Stratford plant.
Mercury this week settled its long-running battle with Utilicorp United for control of Power New Zealand when the companies agreed to set up a joint company to control PNZ.
That deal would remove a significant distraction, Macaulay said.
The 1997 profit only included dividend income from its 33 percent holding in PWR.
